intro: Paspalidium ophiticola, commonly known as the grass of fire, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to survive in nutrient-poor environments. Paspalidium ophiticola is known for its resilience and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
